Package ML.Learning

Class SARSA

  • java.lang.Object
    • ML.Learning.SARSA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class SARSA
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The main implementation of the SARSA learning algorithm.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SARSA​(bwapi.UnitType type, StateSpaceManager spaceManager)
      Initializes the SARSA learning algorithm, creates/loads the DataManager, sets the StateSpaceManager, and creates a new QTable from the set of possible States and Actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SARSA

        public SARSA​(bwapi.UnitType type,
             StateSpaceManager spaceManager)
        Initializes the SARSA learning algorithm, creates/loads the DataManager, sets the StateSpaceManager, and creates a new QTable from the set of possible States and Actions.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of unit the learning algorithm is working around.
        spaceManager - the StateSpaceManager.

    • Method Detail

      • computerQValue

        public double computerQValue​(State current,
                             Action action,
                             State next,
                             double reward)
        Computes the Q-Value for SARSA which requires the current State, Action executed, next State, and reward. This uses the following update function: Q(s_(t), a_(t)) = Q(s_(t), a_(t)) + a * [r_(t) + g * Q(s_(t+1), a_(t+1)) - Q(s_(t), a_(t)] Where the terms are defined as the following: Q(s, a): the Q-Value function that returns a Q-Value for a (State, Action) pair. s_(t): the State at time step t. a_(t): the Action at time step t. a: the learning rate (alpha). r_(t): the reward received at time step t. g: the discount factor (gamma).
        Parameters:
        current - the current State.
        action - the Action executed in the current State.
        next - the resulting next State from the (current, action) pair.
        reward - the reward produced from executing the current Action in the current State.
        Returns:
        returns a double which is the resulting Q-Value produced by the defined update function.

      • updateQTable

        public void updateQTable​(State current,
                         Action action,
                         State next)
        Updates the QTable with the resulting Q-Value produced from the (current, action, next) tuple. This method calculates the produced reward and Q-Value then puts the Q-Value into the (State, (Action, double)) map.
        Parameters:
        current - the current State.
        action - the Action executed in the current State.
        next - the resulting next State.

      • loadQTable

        public void loadQTable()
        Attempts to load the QTable from disk.
